title: 2017 Premiership Rugby Sevens Series
text:
The 2017 <a href="Premiership%20Rugby%20Sevens%20Series">Premiership Rugby Sevens Series</a> was the eighth <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="Rugby%20sevens">7-a-side</a> competition for the twelve <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">2017–18 Aviva Premiership</a> clubs, and the first to exclude the four <a href="Wales">Welsh</a> Regions which compete in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a>, since 2013. It was also the first to feature a new format with all twelve teams together in one venue over two days.
The competition was held at <a href="Franklin%27s%20Gardens">Franklin's Gardens</a> on 28 and 29 July 2017.
Format.
The twelve teams were split into four groups – A, B, C & D. Each team in the group played each other once, to <a href="World%20Rugby">World Rugby</a> Laws of the Game – 7s Variations.<br>

Following all matches in each group, the winner and runner-up in each group progressed to the quarter-finals and the third-placed team progressed to the bowl semi-final. The winners of each quarter-final qualified for the cup semi-finals, with the losers moving into a new plate tournament. Thereafter, competition was a simple knockout bracket, with the winner of the cup final being declared the series winner.
Group stage.
Date: Friday, 28 July 2017
Venue: <a href="Franklin%27s%20Gardens">Franklin's Gardens</a>, <a href="Northampton">Northampton</a>
Finals stage.
Finals day was played at <a href="Franklin%27s%20Gardens">Franklin's Gardens</a> on Saturday, 29 July 2017.
The four pool winners played a quarter-final against a runner-up from another or the same pool. The winner of these quarter-finals competed in the cup competition, while the losers competed in the plate competition. The remaining four teams competed in the bowl competition.
